intro: Mediolobivia haagei var. flavovirens, commonly known as the golden-green mediolobivia, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, variegated foliage that displays a combination of green and yellow hues. The plant features dense, compact growth with fleshy, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom during the warmer months. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is highly sought after by collectors and botanists alike.
